item.title: Quantum Zeno Effect
item.description: Introduction Zeno Paradox , or Arrow paradox of Zeno Paradoxes argues that [Wiki page]: If everything when it occupies an equal space is at rest, and if that which is in locomotion is always occupying such a space at any moment, the flying arrow is therefore motionless In 1977, Misra and Sudarshan showed [Misra 1977], based on the quantum measurement theory, that an unstable particle will never be found to decay if it is continuously observed [Petrosky 1990].
